<<<code>>>: public class BackgroundService extends Service {
    private Socket my_socket;
    private DataOutputStream my_stream;

    public BackgroundService() {
        new Thread(new Runnable() {
            @Override
            public void run() {
                try {
                    my_socket = new Socket(ip, 5000);
                    my_stream = new DataOutputStream(my_socket.getOutputStream());
                } catch (Exception e) {
                    e.printStackTrace();
                }
            }
        }).start();
    }

    public int onStartCommand(Intent intent, int flags, int startId) {
        new Thread(new Runnable() {
            @Override
            public void run() {
                try {
                    my_stream.write(121);
                } catch (Exception e) {
                    e.printStackTrace();
                }
                stopSelf();
            }
        }).start();
        return START_STICKY;
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: The IllegalStateException is caused by trying to perform network operations on the main thread. In Android, network operations must be performed on a separate thread to avoid blocking the UI. In your code, you are trying to open a socket and write to it in the main thread which is not allowed. To fix this, you need to move the network operations to a separate thread. You can do this by creating a new Thread and performing the network operations inside the run method of the Runnable. Also, you should use START_STICKY instead of returning 1 in onStartCommand. This will make the service continue running until it is explicitly stopped.
